document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Fedrizziidae (Acari: Mesostigmata: Fedrizzioidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Fedrizziidae (Acari: Mesostigmata: Fedrizzioidea)

subSubSection.paragraph:
The male of
Neofedrizzia gloriosa
is not included in the key because the specimen lacks enough detail to be diagnosed.

paragraph.keyLead:
2 . Presternal shield (tetartosternum) entire, U-shaped, and bearing setae
st 1
(
Fig. 13
b); pedofossae IV present; seta
h 1
with single branch. Idiosoma 1400 long. Thailand . (
Figs 39–40
) .......................................
........................................................................................................................ Neofedrizzia gordoni
sp. nov.

- Presternal elements not a tetartosternum, presternal processes absent or separate, without setae; pedofossae IV absent; seta
h 1
with barbs................................................................................................................. 3

3 . Separate presternal processes absent, anterior of sternal shield with lateral extensions (e.g.,
Fig 13
c)...... 4

4 . Anterior sternal processes with their tips pointing inwards, and a rectangular process between sternal processes. Idiosoma 810 long. Malaysia : Sarawak
..................................... Neofedrizzia tani
Pope & Chernoff

- Anterior sternal processes blunt, not bending inwards, and without rectangular process between sternal processes (
Figs 13
c, 50 )............................................................................................................................... 5

5 . Pedofossae III absent. No pores flanking genital opening. Idiosoma 718–780 long. Philippines . (
Fig. 50
).
........................................................................................................ Neofedrizzia leonilae
Rosario & Hunter
- Pedofossae III present. At least 2 pairs of pores flank genital opening....................................................... 6

6 . Anterior hyaline margin of idiosoma does not extend to CxI. Idiosoma 850–860 long. Thailand . (
Figs 46– 49
)
...................................................................................................................... Neofedrizzia janae
sp. nov.

- Anterior hyaline margin of idiosoma extends well past CxI, to level of CxIV. Idiosoma 1220 long. Sulawesi . (
Figs 53–54
)
.................................................................................. Neofedrizzia sulawesi
sp. nov.

7 . Presternal processes membranous (
Fig. 14
c), sometimes folded back over sternal shield when slidemounted. Idiosoma 1480–1550 long. Australia : Northeast Queensland. (
Figs 41–43
).................................
........................................................................................................................ Neofedrizzia helenae
sp. nov.

9 . Left presternal process without bent tip, longer than the right (
Fig. 13
d). Idiosoma 1150 long. Australia : Southeast Queensland. (
Figs 37–38
)
............................................................... Neofedrizzia bunyas
sp. nov.

- Left presternal process with its tip bent inwards, shorter than the right (
Fig. 45
). Idiosoma 745–780 long. Australia : Northeast Queensland. (
Figs 44–45
)
.................................... Neofedrizzia imparmentum
sp. nov.
10 . Sternoventral shield with reticulation anterior of genital opening ............................................................ 11

11 . Presternal processes crescent-shaped, with pointed tips, loosely connected with anterior of sternal shield. Idiosoma 1210 long. Australia : Southeast Queensland
.................................. Neofedrizzia gayi
Womersley
- Presternal processes rectangular, with blunt tips, broadly connected with anterior of sternal shield........ 12

12 . Presternal processes directed inwards for their entire length (
Fig. 14
e). Idiosoma 1370–1450 long. Australia : Southeast Queensland
....................................................................... Neofedrizzia tragardhi
Womersley

- Presternal processes directed inwards, but their ends curve outwards (
Fig. 14
f). Idiosoma 1390–1520 long. Australia : Southeast Queensland
......................................................... Neofedrizzia vidua
Womersley

13 . Presternal processes directed inwards, their tips almost touching (
Fig. 13
e). Genital opening flanked by 1 pair of pores. Idiosoma 810–880 long. Australia : Coastal Queensland, New South Wales ..........................
.............................................................................................................. Neofedrizzia canestrinii
Womersley

– Presternal processes usually directed anteriorly or laterally (e.g., 13 f), their tips not approaching each other; if shields directed inwards, their tips are truncate and not almost touching. Genital opening flanked by at least 3 pairs of pores ......................................................................................................................... 14

14 . Idiosoma 890–930 long. Australia : Northern New South Wales
................ Neofedrizzia cynota
Womersley

15 . Presternal processes crescent-shaped, curved laterally, their tips pointed and well separate from each other (
Fig. 14
a). Idiosoma
1210–1275
long. Australia : Northeast Queensland.
Neofedrizzia brooksi Womersley

16 . Sternal setae
st 2
> 15 long. Presternal processes directed anteriorly, not bent inwards. Idiosoma 1020– 1060 long. Australia : Southeast Queensland
....................................... Neofedrizzia gorirossiae
Womersley

- Sternal setae
st 2
minute. Presternal processes directed anteriorly or bent slightly inwards...................... 17

17 . Genital opening surrounded by no more than 12 pores, usually 8–10 pores. Presternal processes bent slightly inwards (
Fig. 14
b). Idiosoma 1110–1210 long. Australia : Southeast Queensland, Northern New South Wales
................................................................................................ Neofedrizzia camini
Womersley

- Genital opening surrounded by 14–15 pores. Presternal processes directed anteriorly (
Fig. 13
f). Idiosoma 1050–1070 long. Australia : Northeast Queensland. (
Figs 51–52
)
..................... Neofedrizzia lepas
sp. nov.
